get.summary: Get all NFTs owned by a wallet address
get.description: Returns a list of all NFTs held within a particular wallet address

parameters.name: tokenType
parameters.description: Define what type of asset you want returned (ERC721, ERC1155, or ERC20 tokens)

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Timestamp sort direction for the return results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return (used to calculate offset)

post.description: Deploy your smart contract in seconds. Supports multiple types of contracts - (i) A standard ERC721 contract (ii) An ERC1155 contract (iii) An ERC721A contract (iv) An Omnichain ERC721 contract (v) An ERC20 contract (vi) A Commerce contract. A commerce contract lets you receive payments seamlessly on chain. An Omni chain contract lets you move your deployed NFTs across multiple blockchains seamlessly

recipientAddress.description: Wallet address of contract owner - optional

chain.description: Blockchain on which NFT contract will be deployed

contractCategory.description: Your contract category. Defaults to simple

example.message: Cannot read property filePath of null

post.summary: Quick mint Omnichain NFT from image
post.description: Mint an Omnichain NFT directly from your specified image file in seconds

filePath.description: Input file for your NFT mint. It could be an image file, or any file.

recipientAddress.description: Wallet addres that NFT will be minted to - optional. If empty, the NFT will be in the default Verbwire wallet.

data.description: Data to be minted in your NFT. If you want attributes viewable on Opensea please see opensea standards [here](https://docs.opensea.io/docs/metadata-standards).

chain.description: Blockchain on which NFT will be minted

post.summary: Quick mint Omnichain NFT from Metadata

imageUrl.description: imageUrl of image to be attached to your NFT - optional. If left empty the default Verbwire image will be used.

recipientAddress.description: Wallet address of NFT owner - optional. If left empty the default Verbwire wallet will be used.

data.description: Data to be minted in your NFT. If you want attributes viewable on Opensea please see opensea standards [here](https://docs.opensea.io/docs/metadata-standards).

post.description: Mint an NFT directly from your specified image file in seconds, using your own contract. Suppports multiple contract types.

filePath.description: Input file for your NFT mint. It could be an image file, or any file.

recipientAddress.description: Wallet address of NFT owner - optional. If left empty the default Verbwire wallet will be used.

data.description: Data to be minted in your NFT. If you want attributes viewable on Opensea please see opensea standards [here](https://docs.opensea.io/docs/metadata-standards).

quantity.description: Quantity of tokens to be minted - optional

tokenId.description: Token ID of NFTs minted. Applicable to ERC1155 tokens only.

chain.description: Blockchain on which NFT will be minted

post.description: Uploads a directory of metadata json files to IPFS. Useful for creating nft collections. The files in your directory should be numbered, example : 1.json, 2.json, 3.json. You will need to upload all the files together at once. The uploaded files to IPFS will all be in the same IPFS directory. Once uploaded to IPFS the file extensions (.json) will be removed. Example : file "1.json" will show up as "1" in the IPFS directory

post.description: Transfer the Operator of your deployed collection contract. Works with only collection contracts.
Add an address (or group of addresses) to the allowlist of your NFT contract.
Set the parameters of your deployed collection contract

maxMintPerAddress.description: Maximum number of NFTs that can be minted per wallet address

totalReserveQty.description: Total number of NFTs to be reserved

totalAllowlistQty.description: Total number of NFTs planned for your allowlist

maxSupply.description: Maximum number of NFTs to be minted on this contract

maxMintableBatchSize.description: Maximum number of NFTs that can be minted in one transaction

royaltiesInBps.description: Royalties, in basis points. Note, 100 basis points is 1 percent

royaltiesAddress.description: Wallet address for your sales royalties

tokenURIPrereveal.description: URI of your pre-reveal image, if applicable

baseTokenURI.description: Base token URI. This gets concatenated with your tokenID to return a tokenURI

allowListMintStartTime.description: StartTime of allowlist Minting. Time should be in epoch format. See [here](https://www.epochconverter.com/) epoch time conversion.

publicSaleStartTime.description: StartTime of public Minting. Time should be in epoch format. See [here](https://www.epochconverter.com/) epoch time conversion.

allowlistMintPriceInWei.description: Mint price for your allow list members. Input price in Wei.

publicPriceInWei.description: Mint price for public minting, i.e not on allow-list and not reserved. Input price in Wei.

metadataFrozen.description: Once set to true you can no longer change the NFT metadata

chain.description: Blockchain on which NFT contract will be deployed

post.summary: Set a payment price for your Commerce Contract

post.description: Enable a wallet address to receive funds from a contract. Use payeeShares to control payout ratio.

payeeAddress.description: The wallet address that will receive funds

payeeShares.description: Payout ratio. If you have just one payee this number doesn't matter. Example, for two payees with payee shares of 80 and 20 it means they split revenues with a 80%/20% ratio.
